alert.note: Alert for Wilkes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 3:21PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Wilkes County through 400 PM EDT... At 320 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Buck, or near Wilkesboro, drifting east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. Heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... North Wilkesboro... Wilkesboro... Ronda... Boomer... Mulberry... Wilkesboro Reservoir... and Buck. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
